explanation: The report is correct. In the older-API branch the code does (void *) tiny_body when calling MHD_create_response_from_buffer. If tiny_body is const-qualified (as it typically is for string literals or a static const char[]), that cast discards the const qualifier and produces a non-const void * that refers to const data. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 requires pointers to point to const-qualified types whenever possible, so casting away const in this way is a violation. (The newer-API branch uses MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static which takes the buffer as const and avoids the cast; if that branch is always available it would be the preferred remedy. Otherwise a documented MISRA deviation or use of a const-correct API wrapper is required.)
